comment.author: 24231207@N07
comment._content: "George Joseph Young (April 1, 1890-March 13, 1950) was a professional Major League Baseball player who played for the Cleveland Naps in 1913. His entire professional career lasted only 2 games." en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Young_(baseball)

comment.author: 44011439@N07
comment._content:
He also played in 1913 and 1914 with the Charleston Senators of the Ohio State Leage, a Class D league in the minors.

Some of his Cleveland teammates were well known hitters, including Joe Jackson and Nap Lajoie.  Both of which hit over .400 in 1 season.

comment.author: 45177340@N05
comment._content: Interesting to see this size of the catcher's glove.
